page.title: 20Steyning Poets
page.content: Standing near the edge of a wild flowering field, the houses down below look out at a beauty show,the wind starts to blow, the flowers all go, the beauty of the flowering field dies into a swaying field of grass. {_____________________________________ The hills are just up the road from us Nearly every Sunday we go up there You nearly see all of the scenery here I shall never forget as long as I live It is so quiet and peaceful up there {______________________________________ From all my memories of Steyning the one of Kings Barn Lane remains the clearest, Especially the old railway And the trips to the River Adur With the holiday makers on their boats And,all through the year the smell of the sewage works wafts through the house.
